Detailed information on material assistance at the University of Krakow

www.stypendia.umk.pl (link: http://www.stypendia.umk.pl/)

https://www.stypendia.umk.pl/stypendium-socjalne/

https://www.stypendia.umk.pl/dokumenty/

https://www.stypendia.umk.pl/jak-wypelnic-wniosek/

The *Application Generator* for the summer semester 2023/2024 social scholarship will be launched from February 05, 2024 to March 05, 2024.

*In order to receive and disburse the scholarship from March this year, it is necessary to submit the application for the social scholarship by March 5, 2024 (*Submission of the application after March 5 will prevent the payment of the scholarship in March).

*1. Students who have received a social scholarship for the winter semester and their family income has not changed submit:*.
* Application for a social grant for the summer semester 2023/2024.
* Statement - appendix 2 to the regulations: (link: https://www.stypendia.umk.pl/wp-content/uploads/OŚWIADCZENIE-STUDENTA2.pdf)https://www.umk.pl/studenci/stypendia-i-kredyty/pomoc/akty/ZR_146_2022_zal_2.pdf

*2.* *Students who applied for a social scholarship for the winter semester and their income has changed submit:*.
* Application for social scholarship for summer semester 2023/2024.

* Income statement from USOSWeb system with changed income - * BEFORE MAKING CHANGES, CONTACT THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMISSION AT THE DEPARTMENT TO UNLOCK THE INCOME STATEMENT*.

* Documents confirming receipt or loss of income and the amount of income received or lost

*NOTE!!!* *In the case of income not exceeding PLN 600, in each case it is mandatory to resubmit a statement on the use of social assistance benefits - regardless of the one submitted in the winter semester - this is the student's obligation under the law. In addition, you must complete the documentation of sources of family income.*.

Students who received an increased social assistance scholarship for the winter semester, if they change their place of residence and apply for an increased scholarship for the summer semester, in addition to the documentation indicated above, they should attach current documentation regarding their place of residence.

*NOTE !!!*.
* A student studying simultaneously in several fields of study may receive the benefit *only in one field of study*.
* A social grant is not available to a student with a professional degree:

1) *Master's degree, Master of Science, Master of Engineering or equivalent,* *.

2) *Bachelor's degree, engineer's degree or equivalent, if he/she is resuming first degree studies*.
* The total period for which benefits are due is 12 semesters regardless of the student's intake, with benefits for studies:
* 1) *first degree - for no more than 9 semesters*.
* 2) *second degree - for no more than 7 semesters*.

*We *would like to remind you that* *an application is considered submitted* *only at the time,* *when* *it is submitted to the Faculty Scholarship Committee.

*receives the APPLICATION along with a COMPLETE DOCUMENT.

*Please do not use staples to staple applications and accompanying documents together.

*Please also check your mailboxes.

If you notice deficiencies in documentation or errors in statements of average income

during the re-verification of the application, Commission members will inform students by email.

*In order to generate an application for a social scholarship, special scholarship, or a financial aid grant, it is necessary to enter a bank account number in the USOS system.

How to check if it is there? Go to the "*For students -> Scholarships -> Student bank account*" tab.

What to do if it is not there? Go to the appropriate tab and enter the bank account number yourself. This number can also be entered at the final stage of filling out the application for a social or special scholarship.

If the USOS system shows an outdated bank account number, it will be necessary to go to the dean's office to change the account number assigned to the student's account.
